pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru

related.meaning: closure (of a ceremony, event, meeting, etc.)

lessons.japanese: 近い将来私達が再会する時があるかも知れません。
lessons.english: We may meet again in the near future.

lessons.japanese: 旧友との再会はとても楽しいものだった。
lessons.english: Meeting my old friend was very pleasant.

lessons.japanese: 間もなく、私たちは再会するだろう。
lessons.english: It will not be long before we meet again.

lessons.japanese: すぐ再会できるだろう。
lessons.english: It will not be long before we meet again.

lessons.japanese: まもなく私たちは偶然に再会した。
lessons.english: It was not long before we met again by chance.

lessons.japanese: 私は君との再会を待ち望んでいる。
lessons.english: I am looking forward to seeing you again.

lessons.japanese: あなたに再会できてうれしい。
lessons.english: I am pleased to see you again.

lessons.japanese: ああ、彼らはいつ再会するだろうか。
lessons.english: Ah, when will they meet again?

lessons.japanese: 不思議な巡り合わせで私達はばったり再会した。
lessons.english: We happened to meet again through a strange coincidence.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は彼に再会するのを楽しみに待っている。
lessons.english: She is looking forward to seeing him again.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は彼に再会するのを楽しみにしていた。
lessons.english: She was looking forward to seeing him again.

lessons.japanese: 彼女に再会できなくなるとは全く思わなかった。
lessons.english: Little did I dream that I would never see her again.

lessons.japanese: 彼は健康が回復したので、もう研究を再会することが可能である。
lessons.english: He has recovered his health, so he is now able to resume his studies.

lessons.japanese: 昔の恋人に再会してみたい。
lessons.english: I would love to see my old flame again.

lessons.japanese: 春樹と真知子はたがいに再会できてうれしかった。
lessons.english: Haruki and Machiko were very happy to see each other again.
